docs.lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) recommended that China adopt an economic growth target of about 7 percent for 2015 and urged authorities to avoid further stimulus measures and concentrate on curtailing financial risks instead.

headline.main: IMF Urges China to Focus on Reforms, Target 7 Percent Growth in 2015
headline.print_headline: IMF Urges China to Focus on Reforms, Target 7 Percent Growth in 2015

docs.snippet: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) recommended that China adopt an economic growth target of about 7 percent for 2015 and urged authorities to avoid further stimulus measures and concentrate on curtailing financial risks instead.

docs.lead_paragraph: Looking back at the stories to remember from the past week:

headline.main: 10 Things to Know: This Week's Takeaways
headline.print_headline: 10 Things to Know: This Week's Takeaways

docs.snippet: Looking back at the stories to remember from the past week:

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers on the local level who support a higher minimum wage show Congress where it needs to go.
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds Seattle's approval of $15-an-hour minimum wage; contends that wage, nation's highest minimum, changes terms of minimum wage debate and expands realm of possibilities in setting new minimums; holds that questions remain as to whether such actions by other cities and states will prompt Congress to follow suit.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers on the local level who support a higher minimum wage show Congress where it needs to go.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many people at or nearing retirement age are purchasing deferred-income annuities that will provide them with an extra monthly income check.

headline.main: Buying a Guaranteed Retirement Income, for Some Peace of Mind
headline.print_headline: Buying a Guaranteed Retirement Income, for Some Peace of Mind

docs.abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column; many at or approaching retirement age long for sense of security that old-fashioned pensions can provide; large insurers are recognizing market, offering deferred-income annuities and other new ways for investors to buy and build pensions on their own.
docs.snippet: Many people at or nearing retirement age are purchasing deferred-income annuities that will provide them with an extra monthly income check.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care workers might have received a hiring bump from President Barack Obama's health care law.

headline.main: US Health Care Workers Lead May Job Gains
headline.print_headline: US Health Care Workers Lead May Job Gains

docs.snippet: Health care workers might have received a hiring bump from President Barack Obama's health care law.

headline.print_headline: Capital Concerns Hit BNP Paribas on Report of $10 Billion U.S. Fine

docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the uninsured have to wait five months for the next chance to seek coverage on the health care overhaul's public exchanges. But that doesn't mean they need to spend the summer worrying about their lack of protection from large medical bills.

headline.main: 4 Ways to Evaluate Alternative Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: 4 Ways to Evaluate Alternative Health Coverage

docs.snippet: Most of the uninsured have to wait five months for the next chance to seek coverage on the health care overhaul's public exchanges. But that doesn't mean they need to spend the summer worrying about their lack of protection from large medical bills.

headline.main: What's News in Washington: D-Day Remembrance

docs.abstract: President Obama joined other world leaders at Normandy’s Omaha Beach to commorate the occasion, and many will be watching any interaction between Mr. Obama and President Vladimir Putin of Russia, who was excluded from this week’s Group of 7 meetings.
docs.snippet: President Obama joined other world leaders at Normandy’s Omaha Beach to commorate the occasion, and many will be watching any interaction between Mr. Obama and President Vladimir Putin of Russia, who was excluded from this week’s Group of 7...

docs.lead_paragraph: A legacy of no significant legislation, no changes for the better in American life, no compromise with the majority of voters. It could have been worse.
docs.snippet: A legacy of no significant legislation, no changes for the better in American life, no compromise with the majority of voters. It could have been worse.

docs.lead_paragraph: The legislation would give the acting secretary of Veterans Affairs more authority to fire senior officials but also to expand access to health care for veterans stuck on long waiting lists.

headline.main: Senators Reach Accord Easing Worries Over Veterans’ Health Measure
headline.print_headline: Senators Reach Accord Easing Worries Over Veterans’ Health Measure

docs.abstract: Sens Bernard Sanders and John McCain reach bipartisan accord to give authority to acting Veterans Affairs secretary to fire senior officials and to expand health care access for veterans who do not live near medical facilities or have experienced long waits.
docs.snippet: The legislation would give the acting secretary of Veterans Affairs more authority to fire senior officials but also to expand access to health care for veterans stuck on long waiting lists.
